queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

metadata.name={{release-name-milvus-querynode}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{querynode}}.volumeMounts.name={{disk}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-etcd}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{etcd}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-minio}}.spec.template.spec.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-minio}}.spec.template.spec.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.query_name: Incorrect Volume Claim Access Mode ReadWriteOnce
queries.description: Kubernetes Stateful Sets must have one Volume Claim template with the access mode 'ReadWriteOnce'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-pulsar-bookie.spec.volumeClaimTemplates has only one template with a 'ReadWriteOnce'

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-pulsar-broker-role.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-pulsar-broker-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-pulsar-broker-role.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-pulsar-broker-role.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-pulsar-broker-role}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-pulsar-broker-role}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: list, watch, get, update, create, delete, patch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
Container should not use secrets as environment variables
Check if StatefulSet resources don't have a podAntiAffinity policy, which prevents multiple pods from being scheduled on the same node.
A StatefulSet requests volume storage.
StatefulSets should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability
